xorgame

Class Controler

  • java.lang.Object
    • xorgame.Controler

  • public class Controler
extends java.lang.Object
    Controler class provides methods and functions that accomplish the game mechanics. It also allows to download game GUI from database and download all information about user account necessary to play. To see general description of the XorGame rules, see Manual.pdf

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Controler(java.lang.String url, int port, java.lang.String databaseName, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Controler class only contructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controler

        public Controler(java.lang.String url,
                 int port,
                 java.lang.String databaseName,
                 java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String password)
          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Controler class only contructor. Connects to database containing game data. When work with Controler is over, connection with database must be closed by calling close() method.
        Parameters:
        url - URL address of XorGame database to connect.
        port - Port number.
        databaseName - Name of database.
        username - Username.
        password - Password.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if connection to database fails, for example because of incorrent username or password.

    • Method Detail

      • abandonPlanet

        public void abandonPlanet(PlanetPK coordinates)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Abandons planet with specified coordinates (sets its User to null).
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Coordinates of the planet to abandon
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified planet does not exists.

      • addEmptyMoon

        public void addEmptyMoon(PlanetPK coordinates,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         int gui)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Add empty moon existing planet.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Coordinates of the planet where moon is to add
        name - Name of created moon
        gui - Index of image of the moon. Possible images can be downloaded from the database by downloadGUI() method.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if given planet does not exist.

      • addEmptyPlanet

        public short addEmptyPlanet(StarPK coordinates,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            int gui)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds empty planet to existing solar system (to existing star). Returns position of new planet in solar system.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Coordinates of the solar system when planet is to add
        name - Name of created planet
        gui - Index of image of the planet. Avaiable images can be downloaded from the database by downloadGUI() method.
        Returns:
        Position of the new planet in solar system
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if given star does not exist.

      • addNewUser

        public void addNewUser(java.lang.String nick,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds new user to the game. Assign him random empty planet.
        Parameters:
        nick - Nick of created user.
        password - Password
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if user with given nick already exists.

      • addStar

        public void addStar(StarPK coordinates,
                    int radius,
                    int gui)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds new star to the galaxy.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Coordinates of the star
        radius - Radius of the star. The bigger the radius, the more power will solar satellites in the system provide.
        gui - Index if image of the star. Available images can be downloaded from the database by downloadGUI() method.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if star with specified coordinates already exists.

      • buildUpBuilding

        public void buildUpBuilding(PlanetPK coordinates,
                            Location location,
                            Building building)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Starts developing of specified building on given location to the next level.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Coordinates of the location when building is
        location - Building may be build either on planet or on the moon.
        building - Building to build.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified location does not exist.
        See Also:
        Location, Building

                           PlanetPK coordinates)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Assigns specified planet to given user.
        Parameters:
        user - User to which planet must be assigned
        coordinates - Coordinates of the planet to colonize
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified planet or specified user does not exist.

      • deleteUser

        public void deleteUser(java.lang.String user)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Deletes specified user from database, Does not delete planets of the user. Planet of the user will by possible to colonize by another user.
        Parameters:
        user - User to delete
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified user does not exist.

      • newShipOrder

        public void newShipOrder(PlanetPK coordinates,
                         Location location,
                         ShipyardItem item,
                         int number)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates new order of building ships.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Coordinates of the location when order is to add
        location - Location - items may be build either on planet or on the moon
        item - Name of item to build
        number - Number of items to builds
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified location or item does not exist.

                            Location location,
                            ShipyardItem item,
                            int number)

        location - Location - items may be build either on planet or on the moon
        item - Name of item to build
        number - Number of items to builds

        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified location or item does not exist.

      • researchUp

        public void researchUp(PlanetPK coordinates,
                       Research research)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates order to research specified technology to next level. If on specified planet is built Research Network, research will be done on all planets that are in the range on the research network. This will shorten time to end the research.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Coordinates of the location when technology is to research
        research - Name of technology to research
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified planet or technology does not exist.

      • sendFlight

        public void sendFlight(PlanetPK startCoordinates,
                       Location location1,
                       Mission mission,
                       PlanetPK endCoordinates,
                       Location location2,
                       Fleet fleet,
                       double speed,
                       int metal,
                       int cristal,
                       int deuter,
                       int antimatter)
                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                       SpeedRateOutOfRange
        Sedns fleet with specified mission.
        Parameters:
        startCoordinates - Coordinates of the starting location
        location1 - Starting location mey be either planet or moon
        mission - Mission of the fleet.
        endCoordinates - Coordinates of the destiny location
        location2 - Ending location may be either planet or moon or debris (when mission is recycle or transport)
        fleet - Fleet to send
        speed - Speed rate of the fleet (in range 0.0 to 1.0)
        metal - Amount of transported metal
        cristal - Amount of transported cristal
        deuter - Amount of transported deuter
        antimatter - Amount of transported antimatter
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if starting or ending location does not exist.
        SpeedRateOutOfRange - Thrown if speed parameter is less than 0 or greater than 1

        from - Nick of the sender

        text - Text of the message
        Throws:

      • updatePlanet

        public void updatePlanet(PlanetPK coordinates)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Refreshes planet materials amount, checks for ended building, research or shipyard orders or flights. Actualizes all planet buildings, technologies and fleets.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Coordinates of the location to update
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown of specified planet does not exist.

      • buildingCost

        public int buildingCost(PlanetPK coordinates,
                        Location location,
                        Material material,
                        Building building)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Calculates cost of developing specified building to the next level.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Coordinates of the location when the building is
        location - Building may exist either on planet or on moon
        material - Kind of material to calculate (Metal, Cristal, Deuter or antimatter)
        building - Name of building to calculate
        Returns:
        Cost of developing specified building on specified location to the next level.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown of specified location or building does not exist.

      • buildingEnabled

        public boolean buildingEnabled(PlanetPK coordinates,
                               Location location,
                               Building building)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks if technological requirements to develop building are met.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Coordinates of the location when the building is
        location - Building may exist either on planet or on moon
        building - Building to check
        Returns:
        True, if all requirements to develop given building are met on the given planet. False, otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified location does not exist.

                                 Location location,
                                 Building building)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException

        location - Building may exist either on planet or on moon
        building - Name of building to calculate

        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified location does not exist

      • flightEnoughShips

        public boolean flightEnoughShips(PlanetPK coordinates,
                                 Location location,
                                 Fleet fleet)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks if specified location has enough ships to send a fleet
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Coordinates of the location to check
        location - Fleet may be sent either from planet or from moon
        fleet - Fleet which is checked
        Returns:
        True, if specified location has enough ships to send given fleet. False, otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified location does not exist.

      • flightFuel

        public int flightFuel(PlanetPK startCoordinates,
                      PlanetPK endCoordinates,
                      Fleet fleet,
                      double speed)
               throws java.sql.SQLException,
                      SpeedRateOutOfRange
        Calculates fuel necessary to send a fleet
        Parameters:
        startCoordinates - Coordinates of the starting location
        endCoordinates - Coordinates of the destiny location
        fleet - Fleet to send
        speed - Speed rate of the fleet - in range from 0.0 to 1.0
        Returns:
        Fuel necessary to send the fleet
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified starting or destiny location does not exist
        SpeedRateOutOfRange - Thrown if speed parameter is less than 0 or grater than 1

      • flightSpeed

        public int flightSpeed(PlanetPK startCoordinates,
                       Fleet fleet,
                       double speed)
                throws java.sql.SQLException,
                       SpeedRateOutOfRange
        Calculates fleet velocity
        Parameters:
        startCoordinates - Coordinates of the start location
        fleet - Fleet to send
        speed - Speed rate of the fleet (in range from 0.0 to 1.0)
        Returns:
        Fleet velovity
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if given location does not exist
        SpeedRateOutOfRange - Thrown if given speed parameter is less than 0 or greater than 1

      • flightTime

        public java.lang.String flightTime(PlanetPK startCoordinates,
                                   PlanetPK endCoordinates,
                                   Fleet fleet,
                                   double speed)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                   SpeedRateOutOfRange
        Calculates time the fleet will fly.
        Parameters:
        startCoordinates - Coordinates of the start location
        endCoordinates - Coordinates of the destiny location
        fleet - Fleet to send
        speed - Speed rate of the fleet (in range from 0.0 to 1.0)
        Returns:
        Time the fleet will fly.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified starting or destiny location does not exist
        SpeedRateOutOfRange - Thrown if speed parameter is less than 0 or greater than 1

      • maxShipItems

        public int maxShipItems(PlanetPK coordinates,
                        Location location,
                        ShipyardItem item)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Calculater maximal number of possible to build ships, according to the location's available resources
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Coordinates of the location
        location - Ships may be built either on planet or on the moon
        item - Name of item to build
        Returns:
        Maximal number of ships possible to build
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified location does not exist.

      • sendFlightPossible

        public boolean sendFlightPossible(PlanetPK startCoordinates,
                                  Location location1,
                                  Mission mission,
                                  PlanetPK endCoordinates,
                                  Location location2,
                                  Fleet fleet,
                                  double speed,
                                  int metal,
                                  int cristal,
                                  int deuter,
                                  int antimatter)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks if it is possible to send a fleet from specified planet to the destiny.
        Parameters:
        startCoordinates - Coordinates of the start location
        location1 - Fleet may start either from planet or from moon
        mission - Mission of the fleet
        endCoordinates - Coordinates of the destiny location
        location2 - Destiny mey be either planet or moon or debris (if the misstion is transport or recycle)
        fleet - Fleet to send
        speed - Speed rate of the fleet (in range from 0.0 to 1.0)
        metal - Transported metal
        cristal - Transported cristal
        deuter - Transported deuter
        antimatter - Transported antimatter
        Returns:
        True, if it is possible to send a fleet from specified planet to the destiny, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if specified starting or destiny localisation does not exist
